documents.document: I'm marching in CBR. Your big city ain't going to have a smaller march than ours are you @HazelScienceNut @gagic_vesna @SchellhornNancy?

@HopeJahren oh no, I'm recommending it to all my colleagues. I identified with a lot of things I'd never been able to talk about.
@HopeJahren though I'm reluctant to recommend it to would-be scientists - it doesn't paint a picture of work/life balance!
Finished #LabGirl by @HopeJahren; read it for the honesty, the insight, the memories, and for the plant #science!

Wondering if mandating that new-fathers go part-time for 18 years would help #genderequity #womeninstem issues.
Like the idea of research orgs stopping staff from attending #science conferences without gender equity in their plenaries. #WomeninScience
Sometimes wonder if all meetings in #scientific workplaces should be chaired by talented psychiatrists. (Love my colleagues though.)
@rrellanalvarez this will sow hill plots or rows?
This is a terrific system - just need it to roll out weed matting too! https://t.co/MEQcyFtyZP

@agrobaz @theGRDC indeed! Look forward to the result!
@americanbeetles that is truly freakish.
Interesting... What variety and sowing time is it? What are the issues at depth? @agrobaz @theGRDC
This is why I love soil coring. How deep are you finding the roots @agrobaz? I like the rig too. https://t.co/3LGBVBKc12
Hopefully both @LarryMattYork!
Alas, no plans yet @LarryMattYork, hence my outrageous jealousy of @alexwhan! When I have have the temporal and financial wherewithal...
@LarryMattYork exciting! Can't wait to see what your up too!
@LarryMattYork and for all of this @EdmundOptics will be your friend.
@LarryMattYork I found putting a Woods glass filter on the UV LEDs was far more important than emission filtering. They put out 5% visible.
@LarryMattYork I'd like to find something better, or at least cheaper, than Delrin!
@LarryMattYork the UV LEDs even have a housing recommended that fluoresces! Not cool.
@LarryMattYork the Delrin is more a warning about using standard lab plastics - many tend to fluoresce.
@LarryMattYork i tried 455 and 365 nm excitation. You might get away with 455 for crowns, but you need a yellow emission filter - see paper
@alexwhan maybe a series of those platform conductors on Japanese trains - the ones who push people inside with white gloves
@alexwhan you need a drone.
Using black Delrin with a matte finish @LarryMattYork https://t.co/ZPxnYeb3J2
Nice system @NeilTWittwer! I have a tractor mounted system for sampling to 2 m. Is it commercial? @AgTech_Services @agrobaz
@alexwhan possibly both.

The tweets of @LarryMattYork deserve a DOI! ⚡️ “Phenes: A brief overview”
https://t.co/vJrEOZ1IGY
@LarryMattYork I wonder if a "plain English" summary is required in papers where it is used? (No more so than other scientific language 🙂)
@LarryMattYork Thanks! A very helpful resource!
@P_B_Wee @ALeighMP @canberratimes don't bother with @Michael99908062 - he's not willing to look up the offers himself
@Michael99908062 I think I mistook you for genuinely confused. But the way you write questions suggests challenge and not desire for answers
@Michael99908062 and hence whether @ALeighMP tweet on APVMA and a real wage cut was accurate, which it is.
@Michael99908062 I don't want to debate whether APS pay has been increasing, merely whether the bargaining policy is to stop the rise.
@Michael99908062 I've at no stage asked you to "mindread" only to read. You can look up all the offers to the various departments.
@Michael99908062 WPI aggregates the whole public sector federal, state, and local and includes overtime.
@Michael99908062 and now you are talking about WPI which is irrelevant to @ALeighMP tweet about the real wage cut policy and APVMA policy.
@Michael99908062 @ALeighMP where in fact he clearly wrote "real wages". I sent you articles to help with the misunderstanding.
@Michael99908062 you wrote in response to @ALeighMP: "can you pls spell out how/where public servants' pay is being cut?"
@Michael99908062 and you think that is because pay rates increased in the federal public service? Despite the expired EAs? I'd read on WPI.
@Michael99908062 @ALeighMP although given the borderline recessionary conditions I suppose deflation is possible
@Michael99908062 Not what @ALeighMP is saying. Those accepted deals are below inflation, as are those holding out likely to be.
@Michael99908062 again, 2% is the maximum allowed by policy with no back pay after no pay raise for two years. Most aren't offered that much
